00053 static int jt_noop(int argc, char **argv) {
00054         return 0;
00055 }
00056 
00057 static int jt_opt_ignore_errors(int argc, char **argv) {
00058         Parser_ignore_errors(1);
00059         return 0;
00060 }

00176         {"get_param", jt_lcfg_getparam, 0, "get the Lustre or LNET parameter\n"
00177          "usage: get_param [-F|n|-N|-R] <param_path1 param_path2 ...>\n"
00178          "Get the value of Lustre or LNET parameter from the specified path.\n"
00179          "The path can contain shell-style filename patterns.\n"
00180          "  -F  When -N specified, add '/', '@' or '=' for directories,\n"
00181          "      symlinks and writeable files, respectively.\n"
00182          "  -n  Print only the value and not parameter name.\n"
00183          "  -N  Print only matched parameter names and not the values.\n"
00184          "      (Especially useful when using patterns.)\n"
00185          "  -R  Get parameters recursively from the specified entry.\n"},
00186         {"set_param", jt_lcfg_setparam, 0, "set the Lustre or LNET parameter\n"
00187          "usage: set_param [-n] [-P] [-d]"
00188          "<param_path1=value1 param_path2=value2 ...>\n"
00189          "Set the value of the Lustre or LNET parameter at the specified path.\n"
00190          "  -n  Disable printing of the key name when printing values.\n"
00191          "  -P  Set the parameter permanently, filesystem-wide.\n"
00192          "  -d  Remove the permanent setting (only with -P option).\n"},
00193         {"list_param", jt_lcfg_listparam, 0,
00194          "list the Lustre or LNET parameter name\n"
00195          "usage: list_param [-F|-R|-D] <param_path1 param_path2 ...>\n"
00196          "List the name of Lustre or LNET parameter from the specified path.\n"
00197          "  -F  Add '/', '@' or '=' for dirs, symlinks and writeable files,\n"
00198                 "respectively.\n"
00199          "  -D  Only list directories.\n"
00200          "  -R  Recursively list all parameters under the specified path.\n"},

00409         /* LFSCK commands */

00411         {"lfsck_start", jt_lfsck_start, 0, "start LFSCK\n"
00412          "usage: lfsck_start <-M | --device [MDT,OST]_device>\n"
00413          "                   [-A | --all] [-c | --create_ostobj [on | off]]\n"
00414          "                   [-C | --create_mdtobj [on | off]]\n"
00415          "                   [-e | --error {continue | abort}] [-h | --help]\n"
00416          "                   [-n | --dryrun [on | off]] [-o | --orphan]\n"
00417          "                   [-r | --reset] [-s | --speed speed_limit]\n"
00418          "                   [-t | --type lfsck_type[,lfsck_type...]]\n"
00419          "                   [-w | --window_size size]"},

00485 };
00486 
00487 int lctl_main(int argc, char **argv)
00488 {
00489         int rc;
00490 
00491         setlinebuf(stdout);
00492 
00493         if (ptl_initialize(argc, argv) < 0)
00494                 exit(1);
00495         if (obd_initialize(argc, argv) < 0)
00496                 exit(2);
00497         if (dbg_initialize(argc, argv) < 0)
00498                 exit(3);
00499 
00500         Parser_init("lctl > ", cmdlist);
00501 
00502         if (argc > 1) {
00503                 rc = Parser_execarg(argc - 1, argv + 1, cmdlist);
00504         } else {
00505                 rc = Parser_commands();
00506         }
00507 
00508         obd_finalize(argc, argv);
00509         return rc < 0 ? -rc : rc;
00510 }
00511 
00512 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00513 {
00514         return lctl_main(argc, argv);
00515 }
